Run Multiple Assessments on a Study

Source: R/Study_Assess.R
Study_Assess.Rd

Attempts to run one or more assessments (lAssessments) using shared data (lData) and metadata (lMapping). By default, the sample rawplus data from the clindata package is used, and all assessments defined in inst/workflow are evaluated. Individual assessments are run using gsm::RunAssessment()

Study_Assess(
  lData = NULL,
  lMapping = NULL,
  lAssessments = NULL,
  lSubjFilters = NULL,
  lTags = list(Study = "myStudy"),
  bQuiet = FALSE
)

Arguments

lData

a named list of domain level data frames. Names should match the values specified in lMapping and lAssessments, which are generally based on the expected inputs from X_Map_Raw.

lMapping

a named list identifying the columns needed in each data domain.

lAssessments

a named list of metadata defining how each assessment should be run. By default, MakeAssessmentList() imports YAML specifications from inst/workflow.

lSubjFilters

a named list of parameters to filter subject-level data on.

lTags

a named list of Tags to be passed to each assessment. Default is list(Study="myStudy") could be expanded to include other important metadata such as analysis population or study phase.

bQuiet

logical Suppress warning messages? Default: TRUE

Value

list of assessments containing status information and results.

Examples

results <- Study_Assess() # run using defaults
#> 
#> ── Initializing `ae` assessment ────────────────────────────────────────────────
#>
